text: Samuel Chao Chung Ting (, born January 27, 1936) is a Chinese-American physicist. With Burton Richter, he won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1976 for discovering the subatomic J/Ïˆ particle. He has been the principal investigator in research with the Alpha Magnetic Spectrometer. Ting was born in Ann Arbor, Michigan. He studied at the University of Michigan. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:Chinese physicists Category:American physicists Category:Scientists from Michigan Category:People from Ann Arbor, Michigan
title: Samuel C. C. Ting
